intro: Mabea juinensis, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and fragrant, yellowish flowers. The plant produces a fruit that is typically round or oval, with a smooth, waxy skin and a sweet, aromatic pulp. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental and edible plant in its native habitat.
